text: Disney's liveaction Beauty and the Beast
is a gorgeous reimagining of the Beloved
1991 classic and it's loaded with
callbacks and Easter eggs to the
animated movie that many even casual
viewers will notice but the new movie
also includes many delicious details
that only super fans might spot the
first time around y k movie lovers it's
Jan here and in this video I'm going to

there are spoilers ahead so if you've

here after you've seen the film when
Beast toest Bell uses an enchanted map
to travel to the one place she's always
wanted to see the destination she
chooses is a lovely nod to a Beauty and
the Beast cameo in another animated
movie can you guess where I'm going with
this yes Bell and Beast travel to Paris
where Beast suggest they visit nraam all
of which is very exciting because Belle
popped up in Disney's animated feature
The Hunchback of nraam where in typical
Belle style she walked along the street
while reading a book there's an
interesting moment during the opening
song Bell where Belle inquires if M Jean
has lost something again and he replies
that he believes he has but he can't
remember what given that Emma Watson's
best known role before Beauty and the
Beast was heri Granger in the Harry
Potter series this feels like an homage
to the scene in the first film the
philosopher stone where after Neville
gets his remal he says to Hermione that
he can't remember what he'd forgot
although Harry Potter fans May well love
this line Beauty and the Beast director
Bill Condon has said that it's a happy
coincidence because the real reason Miss
Jean can't remember what he's forgotten
is because of the enchantress's spell
and how it's made the town's people
forget that the castle and the enchanted
objects ever existed so what jean can't
remember here is that he's actually
missed a pots and his conversation with
bell is some clever foreshadowing for
the reveal later on that he's married to
Mrs pots perhaps a somewhat unfortunate
consequence of the changed dialogue is
that we never got that brilliant line
from the original where the baker rudely
interupts Belle with the line Marie the
baguettes because he's bored of
listening to her talk about the book
she's been reading in the new movie
Belle's conversation with Miss Jean
replaces that conversation with the
baker but there's a nod with a Twist to
that moment as Belle still gets brushed
off but this time it's by Miss Jean when
he says that the book she's returning to
perab be sounds boring Jean's line is
also a joke at the expense of the story
of Romeo and Juliet which is the book
that Belle's just been reading in this
film and also the one she taught the
Beast to read in the original animation
in the new movie The Beast also pokes F
at Romeo and Juliet when he introduces
Bell to his Library saying that there
are so many things that are better to
read than that Shakespearean tragedy
about heartache and pining Jean Coo's
1946 film labell laet is one of director
Bill condon's favorite movies and he
found it a source of inspiration for his
own 21st century remake of the story for
instance there a different setup to the
1991 movie for Belle's father in this
version Maurice is taken prisoner by
Beast for picking a white rose given
condon's love for the French film his
use of the white rose as a hat tip to
cocko film where Belle's father is
caught by the beast when he takes a rose
from BEAST's Garden the idea for which
itself came from the original mid 18th
century French story and Beauty in the
beast's filmmakers included a nice
Easter egg and homage to the author of
that very first Beauty in the Beast
story Gabrielle suzan Barbo when they
named B's Hometown vov shortly after
Maurice enters the Beast Castle see
seing shelter Cadenza the harsy cord
starts playing be guest but suddenly
stops when Maurice goes into the room
this is a delightful Easter egg to the
fact that in the animated movie be guest
was initially actually going to be
performed by the enchanted objects for
Maurice rather than for Bell myestro
Cadenza who's married to the opera
singer Madame deard Rob and becomes a
harsy cord under the curse is a new
character created for the liveaction
adaptation but cadenza's inclusion in
this film is still a hat tip to ve 's
original story as well as to Le pran de
boman's adaptation a few years later
both of which feature Beauty playing the
harsy cord in her own home and also
reveal that Beast has a harpy cord in
his castle on top of that myestro
cadenzza is also a little musical homage
to the 1997 director video midquel
Beauty and the Beast the Enchanted
Christmas in which the main villain was
the music conductor and composer myestro
Forte who became a pipe organ during the
curse the live action film makes this
connection when just before be guest
cogsworth requests that Cadenza play
quietly and Cadenza replies soov V of
course soov V and Forte are musical
terms which are basically opposites of
each other which is fitting because
Cadenza is a good character and Forte
was a villain the songs in the new
Beauty in the Beast also include
tributes to a variety of classic
musicals for Be Our Guest director Bill
Condon has confirmed the new musical
number includes over a dozen references
including Westside Story Singing in the
Rain Cabaret and Chicago which Condon
wrote the screen play for as well as
nods to Esther Williams and Busby
Berkeley both of which also influenced
the 1991 version plus there's also a
little reference to Mulan Rouge that
starred y McGregor who plays lumere in
Beauty and the Beast when Disney were
going through the music archives of the
animated film they came across some
original lyrics by the late Howard
Ashman which didn't make it into the
final film back in 1991 so director Bill
Condon decided to put them to good use
in his liveaction version and when I
interviewed Condon recently he told me
that they're the last lines that Emma
Thompson sings as Mrs pots when she
reprises the Beauty and the Beast song
at the end of the movie which are winter
turns to Spring famine turns to Feast
nature points the way nothing left to
say beauty and the beast but that's not
all folks when I interviewed Alan Menin
recently he told me that some of Howard
ashman's unused lyrics in the 1991 movie
also made it into the liveaction version
of the song Gaston when I hunt I sneak
up with my
quiver Beasts of the field say a
pray first I carefully aim for the liver
then I shoot from behind is that fair I
don't care by the way Menin told me that
those lyrics didn't make it into the
original film as sneaking up and
shooting an animal in the liver was
probably a bit much for a younger
audience music boxes play an important
part in the new film as bel's father
Maurice is an artist who makes them but
they're also a callback to the animated
feature in early drafts of the 1991
script Mrs potts's son chip only had one
sentence of dialogue and the other
scenes where he appears in the film as
we know it today were going to feature
in his place a music box character which
spoke only by making little chiming
noises but when the producers realized
the movie would benefit from a child's
perspective they increased Chip's role
and got rid of the music box character
after chip says his famous line from the
original animation mama there's a girl
in the castle he follows It Up by asking
Mrs pots what kind of tea the girl likes
and then lists a few different types
including chamomile which is a delicious
easteregg egged the original name the
filmmakers were going to give the
talking teapot in their animated movie
Yes back in 1991 Mrs pots was very
nearly named Mrs chamomile after the
soothing herbal tea but the filmmakers
decided to go with a name we know and
love today as they thought chamomile
might be difficult for young children to
say towards the start of the movie we
see Belle teaching a young girl to read
and pointing to a page with a bluebird
on it the page says the blue bird that
flies over the dark wood which is a nod
to the blue birds that fly over the wood
at the start of the animated movie and
also to the blue colored bird that
appears during the song something there
when we hear that song in the original
film Bell is trying to bring out the
beast's gentler Side by encouraging him
to feed the birds in his garden at first
they're all scared away with the
exception of a little bluebird who jumps
into his hand by the way look closely at
what Belle's wearing as she teaches the
young girl and you'll see that her
cardigan has blue birds embroidered into
the pattern after Gaston and lefu
finished their big song and dance number
at the tavern Gaston compliments his
loyal sidekick on how great he is and
asks how is it that no girl has snatched
you up yet and the fu replies with a
nice Easter egg to Frozen saying that
I've been told I'm clingy but I really
don't get it Josh Gad of course plays
both lefu and Frozen's Olaf an adorable
snowman who just loves introducing
himself to the movie's human characters
with the line hi I'm Olaf and I like
warm hugs and who's also happy to melt
for the right person as well as being a
Frozen Easter egg lefo reply also
foreshadows what the movies director has
called the character's gay moment at the
end of the movie just outside the
tavern's doors there are two wooden
carvings of wild bads and one is used by
the angry mob to try and RAM down the
door to the beast's Castle although this
is a change from the animated film where
the villagers chop down a tree to batter
the Beast store it's actually a really
nice hint to the design of the Beast
wild BS were one of the animals that
Disney artist Glen Keane took
inspiration from when he was creating
the animated BEAST's look in fact if you
look at the beast in the 1991 movie
you'll see that he has the tusks of a
wild boar but long before Disney's much
Lov classic the Beast was already
associated with boes back in the late
19th century for example the English
artist Walter crane portrayed the Beast
as a wild boar in his illustrations for
children's picture books speaking of BS
the coat of arms in the beast's Castle
consists of a lion a boar and the
letters WD just as BS influenced the
Beast design in the animated movie so
too did lions with the Beast having a
lion's man as for the WD monogram that's
a nod to Walt Disney
when Bella is surprised that Beast is
able to complete a quote she says from
Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream
he explains that he had an expensive
education this is a change from the
animation where the Beast has trouble
reading but it's also a reference to the
role that made actor Dan Stevens who
plays the Beast famous in the popular
period drama D and Abbey Steven's
character Matthew Crawley also enjoys an
expensive education which included a
private boys only boarding school
followed by Oxford University and
intriguingly that's mirrored in Dan
Stevens own own life as he too attended
a private boarding school before going
on to study at Cambridge University at
the end of this movie Belle looks at The
Prince and asks how would you feel about
growing a beard which director Bill
Condon told me is an unused line of
dialogue that Lyricist Howard Ashman
came up with for the animated classic
interestingly enough Glen Keane who
designed the animated beast for that
film didn't want the Beast to turn back
into the prince at the end of the movie
